pageContext.claim: “But [coal mining has] become much safer. In Australia, now they have no black-lung disease. They really get all of the dust out of there. They've done a fantastic job. We'll copy that to our system. We give -- we give credit where credit is due.”
pageContext.analysis: Standards for coal miners have improved over the years, but that doesn't mean they are safe. Plus, in February 2019, Australia announced 20 miners were diagnosed with “coal dust diseases” in two weeks — hardly an eradication of diseases caused by coal mining.
